definition: to pull a face/to grimace/to scowl

to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance
ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations

sentences.english: Look! The little boy is making faces at us.
sentences.chinese: 瞧，那个小男孩在冲我们做鬼脸。

sentences.english: Had a Cowlick In Its Hair…And Didn't Pull a Face When Photographed.
sentences.chinese: 发一团糟，拍照的时候也没有做鬼脸。

sentences.english: He made faces at the baby to make it laugh.
sentences.chinese: 他向婴儿做鬼脸来逗他发笑。

sentences.english: You ought ton't do expressions in class.
sentences.chinese: 上课无所不能做鬼脸，出洋相。

sentences.english: When the curtain fell the actor was still mugging to the audience.
sentences.chinese: 幕落时，那个男演员还在向观众做鬼脸。

sentences.english: When she saw that her boyfriend was not happy, she made faces to amuse him.
sentences.chinese: 看到自己的男朋友不开心，她就做鬼脸逗他。

sentences.english: Lin Tao made faces, and the baby didn't cry any more.
sentences.chinese: 林涛做鬼脸，那个婴儿就不再哭了。

sentences.english: I saw him make mops and mows at Mary.
sentences.chinese: 我看见他冲着玛丽做鬼脸。

sentences.english: To signal the end of a conversation, clamp your hands over your ears and grimace.
sentences.chinese: 为了暗示谈话的结束，在你耳朵边拍手，做鬼脸。

sentences.english: The most common photobomb is someone in the background making a face.
sentences.chinese: 最常见的“图片炸弹”是有人在后面做鬼脸。

sentences.english: The children made faces at one another.
Sent to stand in the corner, he makes faces for his classmates and writes a lament on the wall.
sentences.chinese: 站在角落罚站时，他又做鬼脸，在墙上写诗骂老师。

sentences.english: I walked by this tree and it seemed to be making a face at me.
sentences.chinese: 路边的这棵树似乎在对着我做鬼脸。

sentences.english: I began to and the baby didn't cry any more.
sentences.chinese: 我开始做鬼脸，接着小孩就不再哭了。

sentences.english: For answer Norah made a face at him.

sentences.chinese: 孩子们一边格格地笑，一边做鬼脸。

definition: wry face/to grimace/to pull a face/comic face/face mask/devil mask
to pout (to express anger or displeasure)
to show off/to put on a show to amuse others
to giggle/to laugh foolishly/to smirk/to simper
to throw amorous or flirtatious glances at sb (esp. of a woman)
to put one's hands on one's hips/also written 插腰[cha1 yao1]
